name: Ihminen (IAPSOP)
content:
Ihminen (IAPSOP) About Archives Practices Contribute Contacts Search     Periodical: Ihminen Summary:  From Pat Deveney's database: Ihminen [Man]. A Monthly Publication Dedicated to Philosophy, Religion, Science. 1922 Monthly Helsinki, Finland. Editor: G.E.O. Knight, honorary editor; Maunu Teraskivi. Succeeded by: Yhteis-Vapaamuurari (offshoot) 1/1, November 1922-1926. This was a popular journal devoted to Masonry, Theosophy, the Rosy Cross and the occult generally, with the stated goal of contributing to the "cultivation of the spiritual cultivation of our nation by plowing its furrow in accordance" with its program -- "Live and act in such a way that you contribute to all that unites us humans, because isolation is an illusion. Therefore be a brother to all." Short articles on Mecca, the Dalai Lama, Stonehenge, etc., and regular contributions by Charles Lazenby. Issues:Ihminen 1922-1926
